title: 3 Ways to View Your Top Artists on Spotify

steps.title: Open the Spotify desktop app or web player (open.spotify.com).
steps.content: Open the Spotify desktop app or web player ( open.spotify.com ). You can view your monthly top artist from your profile on desktop, but not in the mobile app.

steps.title: Click on your profile picture in the top right corner and select “Profile.”
steps.content: Click on your profile picture in the top right corner and select “Profile.” You’ll be taken to your profile page.

steps.title: Scroll to view “Top artists this month.”
steps.content: Scroll to view “Top artists this month.” Click “Show all” to see the complete list. You can also view “Top Tracks This Month” to see your top songs. [1] X Research source Your top artists are based on the total number of streams they got from you—so, how many times you listened to one of their tracks for a minimum of 30 seconds. The more you listen to them, the more likely it is that they’ll be one of your top artists in any given month. This is true whether you listen to one of their songs on repeat, or many songs just once. [2] X Research source

steps.title: On mobile, go to the "Wrapped" feed in the Spotify app.
steps.content: On mobile, go to the "Wrapped" feed in the Spotify app. Login to your account if you aren’t already signed in. Then, tap the “Home” icon in the toolbar at the bottom of the screen. Look for the Spotify Wrapped feed (a banner or button). Select “Your Wrapped” to see your Spotify Wrapped stories. Watch or tap through the stories to see your top artists of the year. [3] X Research source

steps.title: On desktop, go to spotify.com/wrapped.
steps.content: On desktop, go to spotify.com/wrapped. Select “Your Wrapped” to view your Spotify Wrapped stories on the desktop app or directly in your web browser. Watch or click through the Wrapped story pages to find your top artists of the year. [4] X Research source Once a yearly Wrapped is released, you’ll always have access to the playlist of top songs, but the statistics will disappear (typically at the end of the year) unless you save them via screenshot or download. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Go to the Stats for Spotify website.
steps.content: Go to the Stats for Spotify website . On the site’s homepage, click “Login with Spotify.”

steps.title: Log in to your Spotify account and grant permissions to the third-party app.
steps.content: Log in to your Spotify account and grant permissions to the third-party app. This is necessary for the tool to analyze your listening data and generate your top artists. After logging in and granting permissions, you will automatically be redirected to the Stats for Spotify website. Read through any third-party app's agreements carefully to see what permissions you’re granting to the tool in order for it to access your Spotify account data. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Select “Top Artists.”
steps.content: Select “Top Artists.” You can view your top artists over the last 4 weeks, 6 weeks, or 12 months by selecting these time periods. [7] X Research source Other popular third-party apps for viewing Spotify data and generating visuals based on the data include last.fm, MusicScape, Receiptify, and How NPRcore Are You. [8] X Research source
